name: Emlagh Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Emlagh Lodge during our trip to Ireland and it was probably the best place we stayed (and none of them were bad, by the way!). When driving up to the house (be careful to follow the directions she e-mails you, it can be a little hard to find), you immediately get a view on the Dingle Bay from her driveway. She gave us a lovely tour of the house and our rooms and was very helpful about things to do in Dingle and recommending places to eat. She was a kind hostess, probably cleaned the whole place from top to bottom every day and prepared the most elaborate breakfast I've probably seen in my life. The view from the rooms is amazing (I'll attach a picture later) and the Dingle town is a great place to stay in general. Even the other guests at her place were great, we had a beer in a local pub with one of her regulars! So, thanks Maggie, we had a great stay!
reviews.title: Thanks Maggie!

reviews.text: our family took two rooms at maggie's charming b&b in June 2012. Our rooms had beautiful water views as promised, and the rooms and baths were very comfortable and clean. Maggie went out of her way to be sure our stay was lovely. When unforeseen circumstances had us arriving later than expected, she changed her plans around to be sure she could meet our arrival. Altogether, her hospitality gave us a wonderful experience in dingle. and as other reviews state, the breakfast truly is terrific.
reviews.title: a treasure

reviews.text: We stayed in the wonderful B&B for 2 nights. Our room overlooked the bay - very comfortable with a huge bathroom. Maggie was a wonderful hostess - breakfast was delicious. The town center is just a short walk away. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
Heavenly House!
reviews.text: Our stay in Dingle, with Maggie, is one of the highlights of our trip to Ireland. Her home is so beautiful, and our room was comfy- it had everything that we needed. In the morning she fixed a delicious breakfast and was very helpful to make suggestions to our itinerary. We really loved the interaction we had with Maggie-she is such a character! We were only there for one night, but we left feeling like we had made a friend in Dingle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights last month in Maggie's charming B & B. We were in the Bayview room, which gave us an outstanding view of the mouth of the harbor as well as the boat traffic and the cows next door. The room was perfect size and had a very large bathroom. We enjoyed opening the windows letting the fresh air in. The room was nicely decorated, and the sheets were of better quality than the Westin bed we slept on in Dublin.
reviews.title: Our home for four nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two weeks in Ireland Sept 2012. In my opinion, Emlagh Lodge was the best B&B we stayed in. Where to begin...
reviews.title: Best B&B in Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Location: Beautiful! The lodge is tucked away along the waters edge with only a few houses surrounding it. My husband and I would walk into Dingle town (~10 to 15 minutes) using the path in front of the house by the water. I loved how quiet and tranquil this B&B was.
reviews.title: Best Place In Ireland!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) The host, Maggie: She is simply wonderful. Funny, warm and accommodating. She is a master in the kitchen.
reviews.title: What more could you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) The room: I swear we had the best room in the house. I forget the name of the room, but the bed room itself had two large windows and the bathroom had a rather large window. Everything was clean and comfortable. Not complaints. And the bathroom was HUGE and very clean.
reviews.title: would stay here again in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are visiting Dingle and have a car, I would recommend taking a drive around the Dingle peninsula. It has some really amazing sea view, it's a real treat if you can drive it on a clear day.
reviews.title: A great B&B - comfortable, quiet, and well-located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second time in Dingle, but first time at Emlagh Lodge. We looked at all the B&B offerings, and after our 4-night stay I can honestly say - I can't imagine a better B&B choice in Dingle.
reviews.title: Just wonderful, all the way around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: All the rooms have uninterrupted views of the water, though each is configured slightly differently. We were in the Bayview room - the view is amazing, the bathroom is huge and the bed is so, so cozy. The Bayview does have some slopes in the ceiling, so if you're over 6 foot that's something to know, but it's worth watching your head to stay here.
reviews.title: Great B&B in Dingle

reviews.text: The shower was strong and hot. The Bayview also comes with a large soaking tub. The wifi is only strong in the breakfast area, which annoyed me at first… but then I grew to love not being distracted by the internet while in our room. We spent a lot of time just gazing at the beautiful view.
reviews.title: Must stay here

reviews.text: LOCATION: Plenty of free parking. The house is at the edge of downtown, with a 5 minute walk down the path (we timed it) you're right in the heart of town. Because it's located on the tip of a bit of land that goes out to the bay it's wrapped in water views. You feel like your miles away from everything.
reviews.title: Another great trip to Dingle
Fantastic B&B in a can't-miss location
reviews.text: PROPERTY: Maggie does a great job of maintaining the property. The home feels well looked after and has a lot of upgrades. Even on the most blustery evening, the house was warm and we were cozy. There isn't a common area to hang out in, but with Dingle at your doorstep you may find that you really don't need that.

This is a great B&B. The room and was nicely decorated, the house was exceptionally clean and well kept and the view was lovely. Breakfast was very good with a nice variety on the menu. Maggie was quick to suggest places to see and visit. She was very helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful View of Dingle Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only draw back was there was no lounge or conservatory for guests to use when connecting to the WiFi. We had to sit in the dinning room that had been set for breakfast which was a little uncomfortable. When we took time in the morning to send emails home, she made a comment that electronics should be banned at breakfast, a gentleman sitting at the next table with his wife replied that this was the only place in the house that we could connect.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at Emlagh Lodge with Maggie for two nights. Beautiful, clean room with lovely hardwood floors and nice bedding. You can't beat the views from two large windows in the bedroom toward the bay and mountains and another in the bathroom toward the hills. Delicious breakfast with a large number of items to choose from. Easy walk to town. Enjoyed our time in Dingle a lot!
reviews.title: The best B & B ever!

reviews.text: I have stayed here twice with friends and it is the best B & B . Everywhere is immaculate, the views are amazing, the breakfast delicious and Maggie can't do enough to help. Just a few minutes walk to the centre of Dingle, it really is the perfect place to stay and I can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Great location & views

reviews.text: What a perfect place to stay - awesome views and just a few minutes stroll into town. Lovely dormer bedrooms and the bathroom has the best view. Nice to be able to sit outside with a bottle of wine enjoying the sunset. Maggie is a star, couldn't have been more helpful and the yummiest breakfast - thanks Maggie!
reviews.title: Beautiful home, beautiful location

description: Emlagh Lodge is located on Dingle shore and commands breathtaking views of the bay & harbour, while you experience the tranquillity of the countryside, the town centre is just a 5 minute stroll along the shoreline & harbour. There are fine restaurants, shops, art galleries and craft centres making traditional Irish goods.Winner of the B&B Network Marketing Award - Best Overall Performance 2006. This prestigious award is indicative of a high level of personal service and attention given to those booking online. "The B&B Network is proud of its award winners and thoroughly recommends Emlagh Lodge to visitors to Dingle". Local Activities & Amenities include; Diving & Sailing Club, Horse Riding, Hill walks & treks along the Dingle Way, "Funghi the Dolphin" boat trips & swims daily, Local restaurants & bars, Local beaches & surfing, Archaeological tours daily, Blasket Island & Local Echo tours daily(Weather permitting), Ceann Sibeal golf course and Shore & Sea Angling.
